thread.title: Ground News - Temperatures soar as New Year heatwave settles in. Here's what to expect and how to stay safe
thread.title_full: Ground News - Temperatures soar as New Year heatwave settles in. Here's what to expect and how to stay safe

author: Ground News
title: Ground News - Temperatures soar as New Year heatwave settles in. Here's what to expect and how to stay safe
text:
Summary by Ground News Bureau of Meteorology data showed many towns across Queensland sweltering through near-40-degree Celsius heat at 10am on Friday. On the coast, Brisbane had reached 37.5C at 1:00pm on Friday while the Gold Coast was expecting to hit 33C. In the outback, temperatures were tipped to skyrocket to 47C in Birdsville. West and central Queensland as well as the Top End were set to suffer some of the most extreme heat. Share menu More

ABC Australia Lean Left High Factuality Government: Australian Government Temperatures soar as New Year heatwave settles in. Here's what to expect and how to stay safe Much of northern Australia is battling through a heatwave with conditions set to peak over the weekend and remain into the New Year. As scorching temperatures hit storm-ravaged communities, residents get creative to keep cool.
